fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`TEST AL, imm8`
`TEST AX, imm16`
`TEST EAX, imm32`
`TEST RAX, imm32`
`TEST r/m8, imm8`
`TEST r/m8*, imm8`
`TEST r/m16, imm16`
`TEST r/m32, imm32`
`TEST r/m64, imm32`
`TEST r/m8, r8`
`TEST r/m8*, r8*`
`TEST r/m16, r16`
`TEST r/m32, r32`
`TEST r/m64, r64`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Computes the bit-wise logical AND of first operand (source 1 operand) and the second operand (source 2 operand) and sets the SF, ZF, and PF status flags according to the result. The result is then discarded.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: In 64-bit mode, using a REX prefix in the form of REX.R permits access to additional registers (R8-R15). Using a REX prefix in the form of REX.W promotes operation to 64 bits. See the summary chart at the beginning of this section for encoding data and limits.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
